ygData.subject: Re: Prexus Server
ygData.msgSnippet: Necro pets as a whole do more damage then the pets of any other class, and have higher HP than all pets, excluding Earth Elementals. The fact that you could
ygData.messageBody:
Necro pets as a whole do more damage then the pets of any other class,
and have higher HP than all pets, excluding Earth Elementals. The fact
that you could heal them is also a bonus. However, at high levels, pet
spells need warbone chips and that is not readily avalible compare to
laziz(sp?) lapis(magician's pet reagent) and tiny daggers(enchanter's
pet reagent)

Necro also do a hell lot of damage at high levels with their DOT spells.
One tactic many necro use is to cast your strongest DOT spell, send your
pet to attack, fear then throw the rest of you DOT spell and cast fear
from time to time. A minute of battle in this manner result in your
enemy taking 1000+ damage past level 20.

Also, their attacks against undead are second only to Clerics. You can
basically solo in the undead dungeons like Befallen as long as you have
a constant supply of reagents.

BTW to all magi/would be magi, do not rely too much on root. At high
levels, it last a very short period to be of any use.

Leshrec wrote:

> On the topic of pets and stuff, after going to prexus, i kinda miss
> the offensive powers of the wizards hehe. Some more at high levels,
> they can travel from places to places with just a spell instead of
> having to walk so damn far and through so many zones.. ( Can anyone
> comment on necros or at least how they fare at higher levels?
> Thanks! Leshrec Tier'dal Necromancer (Prexus)
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sereph <garford@...>
> To: sg-everquest@onelist.com <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> Date: Thursday, June 10, 1999 8:04 PM
> Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] Prexus Server
> Magician? They hit a brick wall when they reach level 16.
> At this point, they must research for their pets and their
> single target direct damage spells. Necros can't solo pass
> mid 20s due to the same problem.
>
> After thinking for a while, I choose to play as a paladin
> since with some equipment, they can solo all the way to
> level 50 by first hunting in Befallen from level 10-20, then
> move on to Unrest and stay there till 30+
>
